STATE OF MICHIGAN
DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES
GRETCHEN WHITMER ROBERT GORDON
LANSING
GOVERNOR DIRECTOR
August 25, 2020
Savator Seldon-Johnson
Kent County DHHS
121 Franklin SE
Grand Rapids, MI 49507-1233
RE: License #: CP410201222
Kent County DHHS
121 Franklin SE
Grand Rapids, MI 49507-1233
Dear Ms. Seldon-Johnson:
Attached is the Amended Interim Report for the above referenced facility completed on
August 25, 2020. Due to the violations of applicable licensing rules, and ISEP
requirements, a written corrective action plan is required. It should be noted that violations
of any licensing rules are also violations of the MSA and your contract. The corrective
action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the following:
 How compliance with each citation will be achieved.
 Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
licensing statute and rule or section of the contract or ISEP citation.
 Repeat violations require explanation on why the previous corrective action
plan did not result in compliance.
 Specific time frames for each citation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
 How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
 The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you fail to submit an acceptable corrective action plan, disciplinary action may result.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager at (616) 552-3662.
P.O. BOX 30650  LANSING, MICHIGAN 48909
www.michigan.gov  (517) 335-1980

Sincerely,
Jessica VandenHeuvel, Licensing Consultant
MDHHS\Division of Child Welfare Licensing
Suite 200
121 Franklin Street SE
Grand Rapids, MI 49507
(616) 204-6992
enclosure
Jennifer Wrayno, BSC Director
2

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
1.) The facility is in compliance with all applicable licensing statutes and rules except
for the following:
R 400.12212 Personnel records.
(3) The personnel record shall contain both of the following:
(a) A written evaluation of a staff member's performance
within a probationary period or not later than 6 months after the
staff member assumes his or her current responsibilities. After
the initial evaluation, a written evaluation shall be conducted
each year.
One of two employee files reviewed did not have an annual written evaluation
completed as required.
REPEAT VIOLATION ESTABLISHED
Renewal Inspection dated 7/12/19, CAP approval dated 7/24/19
2.) Any violation listed in section 1 is also an ISEP violation. Please note that there are
additional ISEP requirements that may not be included in section 1. The facility is in
compliance will all additional ISEP requirements.
3.) Any violation listed in section 1 is also a DHS Contract violation. Please note that there
are additional DHS Contract/Policy requirements that may not be included in section
1. The facility is in compliance will all additional DHS Contract/Policy requirements.
SRM 200 Fingerprints
Personnel Training
SAT is required to be taken within six months of working in a
position with CW-CHRI access and every two years thereafter.
CPAs are responsible for ensuring that all personnel with CHRI
access completes SAT timely.
Based on the Learning Management System (LMS) employee transcripts five
employees were found to be in non-compliance to timely/completion/recertification
of Fingerprint Security Awareness Training. Two employees completed SAT training
after the required initial due date or did not timely complete recertification as
indicated in SRM 200 policy. The remaining three employees will need to complete
SAT training as soon as possible to retain access to CHRI. Although they may not
have direct access within MISACWIS as part of their roles as management, their
access includes case conferences and review of CHRI information with staff to
determine licensing recommendations and placements.
4

IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
The facility did not require technical assistance.
V. CONSULTATION
The facility was not in need of consultation.
VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this licensing
period.
AND
The agency has submitted one acceptable corrective action plans not related to
maltreatment during this licensing period for the 2019 Renewal Inspection. There
was one citation for completion of employee evaluations, which is a repeat violation
in this inspection.
The agency licenses a small number of foster homes to serve ICPC requests and
other county requests as Kent county is privatized. The agency typically has one
licensing worker who was unavailable on the day of the inspection due to beginning
a leave of absence. A staff will begin on Monday August 3, 2020 to fill in for the
licensing worker in her absence. This staff has previous licensing experience and
the required licensing training. A virtual tour was provided where CHRI was
observed to be stored securely in a locked cabinet in the licensing worker’s cubicle.
A cross-shredder was observed in the administration section of the building for
destruction of CHRI when needed.
VII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules and/or ISEP requirements and/or policy. Upon receipt of
an acceptable corrective action plan, it is recommended that the facility continue on a
regular license.
August 25, 2020
________________________________________
Jessica VandenHeuvel Date
Licensing Consultant
5

Approved By:
August 25, 2020
________________________________________
Claudia Triestram Date
Area Manager
